citation.title: Estimating Global Abundance and Evaluating Changes in At-Sea Distribution of Threatened Spectacled Eiders: Data to Inform a Status Assessment

onlineResource.name: USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository
onlineResource.description: Folder in the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository where archived data products are held.

resourceInfo.abstract: The global population of spectacled eiders is listed as Threatened.  While Alaska-breeding populations may be nearing recovery criteria, a recent estimate of abundance in Arctic Russia is not available.  Project goals include estimating abundance of the global population of spectacled eiders from which we can infer the size of the Russian population, and evaluating changes in distribution at marine molting, staging, and wintering areas.  Methods include marking birds at Yukon Delta NWR with satellite transmitters and conducting winter aerial surveys.  Results will be used to inform a status assessment that could recommend delisting.

metadataCitation.title: Metadata for Estimating Global Abundance and Evaluating Changes in At-Sea Distribution of Threatened Spectacled Eiders: Data to Inform a Status Assessment

resourceDistribution.description:
Preservation of this project and its products will follow the guidance of the Alaska Region Interim Data Management Guide by the creation of an archive folder in the Regional Data Repository with the assistance of the FES Data Manager. 

All data products, with associated metadata, are available for sharing at the time those products are submitted to the Regional Data Repository.

processStep.description: Band with a size 7A metal USGS band and record band number on SPEI data sheet.
Collect morphometric data and record data on SPEI capture data sheet.

resourceLineage.statement: Capture and sampling protocol for male Spectacled Eiders not implanted with transmitters.
Capture and sampling protocol for Spectacled Eiders implanted with transmitters (all female, some male).

processStep.description: Record capture time on SPEI data sheet.

Determine which sedative treatment group membership. To achieve a balanced sample, we alternate between experimental doses and control doses based on sequence of capture. We randomly assign a treatment to the first bird captured in the study and alternate between treatments thereafter. The dosing will be continued across capture days.

If in experimental treatment, slowly inject 3.5 mL of midazolam into a pectoralis and record injection time on SPEI data sheet. If in control group, slowly inject 3.5 mL of sterile saline into a pectoralis and record injection time on SPEI data sheet.

Doses are prepared in advance by the veterinarians and the syringes are brought pre-loaded to the capture site from the field camp. 
To administer the dose, one person holds the bird with its wings secured and with its belly oriented upward. The person administering the dose locates the keel along the midline of the breast. The injection site is approximately 1 cm lateral of the keel. The person administering the dose parts the feathers at the injection site with the thumb and forefinger of one hand and insert the needle through the skin and into the pectoralis. The dose is administered by slowly depressing the plunger of the syringe while being careful to avoid leakage of the dose from the syringe prior to injection. When the plunger of the syringe is completely depressed and no dose remains, the syringe is removed from the muscle and placed in a sharps container.
Band right leg with a size 7A metal USGS band and record band number on SPEI data sheet.
Place bird in kennel. Place the Spectacled Eider Captures data sheet for that bird in the ziplock bag that is attached to its kennel.
Transport bird to camp for transmitter surgery

Body mass was measured using an electronic balance and small pitcher. Before measuring the mass of each bird, we tared the scale to the pitcher. Birds were placed in the pitcher so that they were restrained, and then the pitcher was placed on the scale. Mass measurements were recorded to the nearest gram.

Culmen length was measured as the length of the upper mandible measured down the midline from the bottom of the v-point where the skin of the head meets the keratinized portion of the mandible (i.e., basally) to the distal tip of the bill nail. Because of wear, we do not base measurement on feathering as the skin closest to the bill keratin is often featherless (Culmen 1 in Dzubin and Cooch 1992). Culmen length was measured to the nearest mm.
Culmen width was measured as the linear distance of the short dimension of the culmen (side-side) at the nares. Culmen width was measured to the nearest mm.

Diagonal tarsus was measured as the linear length of the diagonal length of the tarsometatarsus bone only, along the outside edge. Fold the foot of the leg being measured and bend the ankle joint, then measure from the front knuckle (most distal point where the tarsometatarsus articulates with the middle toe) to the defined edge of the tarsometatarsus in the ankle joint. Diagonal tarsus was measured to the nearest mm.

Total tarsus was measured similarly to diagonal tarsus, but starts at the outside of the ankle joint, instead of within the joint. Total tarsus is the diagonal length from the front knuckle (most distal point where the tarsometatarsus articulates with the middle toe) to the rounded exterior portion of the distal condyles of the tiabiotarsus (where this bone is nearly at right angles to the tarsometatarsus). The total tarsus measurement is longer than the diagonal tarsus measurement because the latter includes a portion of the tibiotarsus as well as the tarsometatarsus. Total tarsus was measured to the nearest mm.

Flat wing was measured as the distance from the blunt end of the wrist joint (flesh at the bend of the folded wing) to the distal tip of the longest primary feather, with the wing flattened against the measuring board or wing ruler and the longest primary extended upward to lie perpendicular to the bend of wing. Flat wing was measured to the nearest 0.1 cm.

resourceLineage.statement: Morphometrics will follow the methods of Dzubin and Cooch (1992).

The unique identification number for the PTT. Value set to "no" for individuals not implanted with a PTT.

Length in mm of the diagonal tarsus defined as per Dzubin and Cooch 1992.
Length in mm of the total tarsus defined as per Dzubin and Cooch 1992.
Length in mm of the culmen defined as per Dzubin and Cooch 1992.
Width in mm of culmen at the fore-nare
Length of the flattened wing in cm as per Dzubin and Cooch 1992.
Body mass in grams as measured on an electronic scale, +/- 1g.
Visual score of abdominal fat observed during surgery to implant transmitters
Notes relevant to bird captures

dataDictionary.description: Describes fields from the SPEI Telemetry Locations tabular dataset.
subject: tabularDataset

domainItem.name: 500 - 1500m
domainItem.definition: Location class greater than 500m  and less than 1500m

domainItem.name: 250 - 500m
domainItem.definition: Location class greater than 250m and less than 500m.

domain.description: Location quality class retrieved from Argos.

domainItem.name: Solution 1
domainItem.definition: The Argos filter algorithm has chosen the primary location solution (lat1/lon1) as the valid location

domainItem.name: Solution 2
domainItem.definition: The user has chosen the alternate location (lat2/lon2) as the valid location.

domain.description: Indicates which of the two location estimates provided by Argos is the valid location, using a user-selected filter algorithm in Movebank.com.

attribute.definition: An identifier for the set of values associated with each record assigned by Movebank.com.

Determines whether an event is visible on the Movebank map. Values are calculated automatically, with TRUE indicating the event has not been flagged as an outlier by 'algorithm marked outlier', 'import marked outlier' or 'manually marked outlier', or that the user has overridden the results of these outlier attributes using 'manually marked valid' = TRUE.
The date and time corresponding to a sensor measurement or an estimate derived from sensor measurements. Format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS in UTC

The geographic longitude of the location as estimated by the sensor. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Format: decimal degrees, WGS84 reference system
The geographic latitude of the location as estimated by the sensor. Positive values are north of the equator, negative values are south of it. Format: decimal degrees, WGS84 reference system.
Identifies events marked as outliers using a user-selected filter algorithm in Movebank. Outliers have the value TRUE.
Altitude used for location calculation, Argos diagnostic data.
Best signal strength, Argos diagnostic data.
Calculated frequency, Argos diagnostic data.
One standard deviation (sigma) of the estimated location error, assuming isotropic error, Argos diagnostic data.
Geometric dilution of precision, a measure of the effect of the geometry of the satellite-beacon configuration on location accuracy, Argos diagnostic data.

A quality indicator that gives information on the transmitter in terms of two digits, X and Y. X is the first digit and indicates residual error on the frequency calculation. Y is the second digit and indicates transmitter oscillator frequency drift between two satellite passes. Values provided in Argos diagnostic data. Values obtained through some Argos channels do not include leading 0s, so 1-digit values indicate X = 0 and blank values or values of 0 indicate both X and Y = 0. Allowed values are X = 0: no calculation of residual frequency error (fewer than four messages received).
Argos location solution 1 for platform latitude in decimal degrees to 3 decimal places. WGS84 reference system.
Argos location solution 2 for platform latitude (the less probable solution) in decimal degrees to 3 decimal places. WGS84 reference system.
Location quality class retrieved from Argos.
Argos location solution 1 for platform longitude in decimal degrees to 3 decimal places. WGS84 reference system.
Argos location solution 2 for platform longitude (the less probable solution) in decimal degrees to 3 decimal places. WGS84 reference system.
Number of messages from the platform received by the satellite used to calculate location.
Number of messages from the platform received by the satellite at a signal strength > -120 db.
Number of plausiblilty checks successful (from 0 to 4); Argos diagnostic data.
Orientation of the semi-major axis of the error ellipse in degrees clockwise from north. Argos diagnostic data.
Time elaspsed between the first and last message received by the satellite. Argos diagnostic data.
The satellite identifier. Argos diagnostic data.
Length of the semi-major axis of the error ellipse. Argos diagnostic data.
Length of the semi-minor axis of the error ellipse. Argos diagnostic data.

Argos sensor data from channel 1, measuring internal temperature of the unit except for every 4th transmission where it indicates the current hour of the presenting ON part of the duty cycle. Values are transformed to scale of degrees C by: deg C = -28.682 + 0.3609 (sensor 1 value).

Argos sensor data from channel 2, measuring battery voltage, except for every 4th transmission when it indicates the current cycle of the present season of the duty cycle. Values are transformed to volts by: volts = 2.978 + 0.0041(sensor 2 value)
Argos sensor data from channel 3, value between 0 and 3, a counter that increments by one on each transmission. On every 4th transmission, this is a spare value, usually 0.

Argos sensor data from channel 4, activity sensor, except for every 4th transmission when it indicates the current season of the duty cycle. Activity sensor indicates movement by checking every minute during PTTs' ON time. If there is movement, the sensor increments up and then wraps to 0 when the maximum value has been reached. Therefore, it is the change or lack of change in this value that provides information on activity rather than the value itself. A value that is constant over several transmissions may indicate a mortality or detached PTT.
UTC time for the location, Argos diagnostic data. Format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss:SSS
Indicates which of the two location estimates provided by Argos is the valid location, using a user-selected filter algorithm in Movebank.com.
The type of sensor with which data were collected, here Argos Doppler Shift = the sensor uses Argos Doppler shift to determine position.
The scientific name of the species on which the tag was deployed as defined by the Integrated Taxonomic Information System.
A unique indentifier for the tag. Same as tag ID.
An individual identifier for the animal. Same as Animal ID.
The name of the study in Movebank.com.

resourceInfo.abstract: March 2020 presentation to the Association of Village Council Presidents Waterfowl Conservation Commission, the Alaska Native Government entity for the Yukon-Kuskokwim Delta region, on satellite telemetry and winter surveys of Spectacled Eiders. Features two videos, not included. The video on slide four shows aerial views of Spectacled Eider flocks. The video on slide 19 shows Spectacled Eiders diving and foraging in an enclosure.
